( 1 - italic_Œ∫ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + 4 italic_Œ∑ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + | 1 + italic_Œ≥ | ( italic_Œ∫ + 2 italic_Œ∑ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ≥ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG ‚â• 0 are some non-negative constants.

The proof of Theorem 2 is relegated to Appendix B. Notice that when Œ∫=1ùúÖ1\kappa=1italic_Œ∫ = 1, we have Œ≤=0,C1=2‚Å¢(1‚àíŒ∑‚Å¢L)formulae-sequenceùõΩ0subscriptùê∂121ùúÇùêø\beta=0,C_{1}=2(1-\eta L)italic_Œ≤ = 0 , italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 2 ( 1 - italic_Œ∑ italic_L ) and the convergence result recovers that of DPSGD (Ghadimi & Lan, 2013; Zhang et al., 2017). With this theorem, we can choose specific parameters and obtain the following corollary:

Corollary 1

Under the conditions of Theorem 2, choose Œ≥=‚àí1,ùõæ1\gamma=-1,italic_Œ≥ = - 1 ,

Œ∑ùúÇ\displaystyle\etaitalic_Œ∑ =min‚Å°{1L‚Å¢(2+4/CŒ∫‚àíCŒ∫),1CŒ∫‚Å¢L‚Å¢2‚Å¢CŒ∫‚Å¢L‚Å¢(F‚Å¢(ùê±0)‚àíF‚ãÜ)+‚à•‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±0)‚à•2T‚Å¢(2‚Å¢œÉSGD2/B+d‚Å¢œÉDP2)},absent1ùêø24subscriptùê∂ùúÖsubscriptùê∂ùúÖ1subscriptùê∂ùúÖùêø2subscriptùê∂ùúÖùêøùêπsubscriptùê±0superscriptùêπ‚ãÜsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±02ùëá2subscriptsuperscriptùúé2SGDùêµùëësubscriptsuperscriptùúé2DP\displaystyle=\min\left\{\frac{1}{L(2+4/C_{\kappa}-C_{\kappa})},\frac{1}{C_{% \kappa}L}\sqrt{\frac{2C_{\kappa}L(F(\mathbf{x}_{0})-F^{\star})+\left\lVert% \nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{0})\right\rVert^{2}}{T(2\sigma^{2}_{\mathrm{SGD}}/B+d% \sigma^{2}_{\mathrm{DP}})}}\right\},= roman_min { divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L ( 2 + 4 / italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_ARG square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 2 italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L ( italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ãÜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + ‚à• ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_T ( 2 italic_œÉ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_SGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_B + italic_d italic_œÉ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_DP end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG end_ARG } ,
Œ≤ùõΩ\displaystyle\betaitalic_Œ≤ =Œ∑‚Å¢(1‚àíŒ∫)/2+Œ∑2‚Å¢L‚Å¢(1‚àíŒ∫)2‚Å¢(1+4‚Å¢Œ∑2‚Å¢L2)1‚àí(1‚àíŒ∫)2‚Å¢(1+4‚Å¢Œ∑2‚Å¢L2)‚â§12‚Å¢CŒ∫‚Å¢L,absentùúÇ1ùúÖ2superscriptùúÇ2ùêøsuperscript1ùúÖ214superscriptùúÇ2superscriptùêø21superscript1ùúÖ214superscriptùúÇ2superscriptùêø212subscriptùê∂ùúÖùêø\displaystyle=\frac{\eta(1-\kappa)/2+\eta^{2}L(1-\kappa)^{2}(1+4\eta^{2}L^{2})% }{1-(1-\kappa)^{2}(1+4\eta^{2}L^{2})}\leq\frac{1}{2C_{\kappa}L},= divide start_ARG italic_Œ∑ ( 1 - italic_Œ∫ ) / 2 + italic_Œ∑ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L ( 1 - italic_Œ∫ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + 4 italic_Œ∑ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG 1 - ( 1 - italic_Œ∫ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + 4 italic_Œ∑ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG ‚â§ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_ARG ,
Œ∫ùúÖ\displaystyle\kappaitalic_Œ∫ =CŒ∫‚Å¢L‚Å¢Œ∑‚â§1,and‚Å¢CŒ∫=min‚Å°{‚à•‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±0)‚à•22‚Å¢L‚Å¢(F‚Å¢(ùê±0)‚àíF‚ãÜ),1},formulae-sequenceabsentsubscriptùê∂ùúÖùêøùúÇ1andsubscriptùê∂ùúÖsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±022ùêøùêπsubscriptùê±0superscriptùêπ‚ãÜ1\displaystyle=C_{\kappa}L\eta\leq 1,\;\;\textrm{and}\;\;C_{\kappa}=\min\left\{% \frac{\left\lVert\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{0})\right\rVert^{2}}{2L(F(\mathbf{x}_{0}% )-F^{\star})},1\right\},= italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L italic_Œ∑ ‚â§ 1 , and italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_min { divide start_ARG ‚à• ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L ( italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ãÜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG , 1 } ,

then Algorithm 3 satisfies:

1T‚Å¢‚àët=0Tùîº‚Å°[‚à•‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±t)‚à•2]‚â§4‚Å¢CŒ∫L(F(ùê±0)‚àíF‚ãÜ))(2œÉSGD2/B+dœÉDP2)T=ùí™‚Å¢(dT).\frac{1}{T}\sum^{T}_{t=0}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[\left\lVert\nabla F(\mathbf% {x}_{t})\right\rVert^{2}]\leq 4\sqrt{\frac{C_{\kappa}L(F(\mathbf{x}_{0})-F^{% \star}))(2\sigma^{2}_{\mathrm{SGD}}/B+d\sigma^{2}_{\mathrm{DP}})}{T}}=\mathcal% {O}\left(\sqrt{\frac{d}{T}}\right).divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_T end_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ‚à• ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚â§ 4 square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L ( italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ãÜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ( 2 italic_œÉ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_SGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_B + italic_d italic_œÉ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_DP end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_T end_ARG end_ARG = caligraphic_O ( square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_d end_ARG start_ARG italic_T end_ARG end_ARG ) . (9)

Convergence improvement: The above result implies that the order of the number of iterations TùëáTitalic_T needed for convergence of Algorithm 3 is the same as of DPSGD (Ghadimi & Lan, 2013; Zhang et al., 2017). However, Algorithm 3 has a constant factor improvement in its convergence rate over DPSGD. This improvement is resulted from the presence of CŒ∫‚â§1subscriptùê∂ùúÖ1C_{\kappa}\leq 1italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ 1 in the numerator in the RHS of (9). More specifically, if CŒ∫<1,subscriptùê∂ùúÖ1C_{\kappa}<1,italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 1 , i.e., ‚à•‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±0)‚à•2<2‚Å¢L‚Å¢(F‚Å¢(ùê±0)‚àíF‚ãÜ),superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±022ùêøùêπsubscriptùê±0superscriptùêπ‚ãÜ\left\lVert\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{0})\right\rVert^{2}<2L(F(\mathbf{x}_{0})-F^{% \star}),‚à• ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < 2 italic_L ( italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ãÜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , then the convergence bound reduces by a factor of 1/CŒ∫,1subscriptùê∂ùúÖ\sqrt{1/C_{\kappa}},square-root start_ARG 1 / italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , and DiSK  has clear theoretical improvement over vanilla DPSGD. Case I: For (Œºùúá\muitalic_Œº-strongly) convex problems, it is guaranteed that 2‚Å¢Œº‚Å¢(F‚Å¢(ùê±0)‚àíF‚ãÜ)‚â§‚à•‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±0)‚à•2‚â§2‚Å¢L‚Å¢(F‚Å¢(ùê±0)‚àíF‚ãÜ).2ùúáùêπsubscriptùê±0superscriptùêπ‚ãÜsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±022ùêøùêπsubscriptùê±0superscriptùêπ‚ãÜ2\mu(F(\mathbf{x}_{0})-F^{\star})\leq\left\lVert\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{0})\right% \rVert^{2}\leq 2L(F(\mathbf{x}_{0})-F^{\star}).2 italic_Œº ( italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ãÜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚â§ ‚à• ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚â§ 2 italic_L ( italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ãÜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) . Therefore, the factor CŒ∫‚àà[Œº/L,1].subscriptùê∂ùúÖùúáùêø1C_{\kappa}\in[\mu/L,1].italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_Œº / italic_L , 1 ] . Case II: When training highly non-convex deep learning models, the Lipschitz constant LùêøLitalic_L can be large (Herrera et al., 2020), and 2‚Å¢L‚Å¢(F‚Å¢(ùê±0)‚àíF‚ãÜ)2ùêøùêπsubscriptùê±0superscriptùêπ‚ãÜ2L(F(\mathbf{x}_{0})-F^{\star})2 italic_L ( italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ãÜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) can be much larger than ‚à•‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±0)‚à•2superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±02\left\lVert\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{0})\right\rVert^{2}‚à• ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which results in a considerable algorithm performance improvement compared to vanilla DPSGD.

While the above corollary is for the case of Œ≥=‚àí1ùõæ1\gamma=-1italic_Œ≥ = - 1, we can obtain performance improvement for Œ≥‚â†‚àí1ùõæ1\gamma\neq-1italic_Œ≥ ‚â† - 1 as well. The choice Œ≥=‚àí1ùõæ1\gamma=-1italic_Œ≥ = - 1 is optimized for the worst case (function satisfying our assumptions) based on our upper-bound in (2). However, it is possible that for functions satisfying additional assumptions, other choices of Œ≥ùõæ\gammaitalic_Œ≥ lead to better convergence result. This fact is further explained after presenting the proof of the theorem in Appendix B.2.

As a last remark in this subsecion, notice that our iteration complexity improvement does not require any additional assumption on the problem. In contrast, existing works with convergence improvement require additional assumptions, e.g., on the correlation between the gradients (Zhang et al., 2024a), or on the trace of Hessian (Choquette-Choo et al., 2024; Li et al., 2022).

4.2 Privacy-utility trade-off

To provide DP, the Subsampled Gaussian mechanism is used in Lines 4 and 5 of Algorithm 3. Instead of ‚àáf‚Å¢(ùê±t;Œæ)‚àáùëìsubscriptùê±ùë°ùúâ\nabla f(\mathbf{x}_{t};\xi)‚àá italic_f ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_Œæ ), we treat 1‚àíŒ∫Œ∫‚Å¢Œ≥‚Å¢‚àáf‚Å¢(ùê±t‚àíŒ≥‚Å¢ùêùt‚àí1;Œæ)+(1‚àí1‚àíŒ∫Œ∫‚Å¢Œ≥)‚Å¢‚àáf‚Å¢(ùê±t;Œæ)1ùúÖùúÖùõæ‚àáùëìsubscriptùê±ùë°ùõæsubscriptùêùùë°1ùúâ11ùúÖùúÖùõæ‚àáùëìsubscriptùê±ùë°ùúâ\frac{1-\kappa}{\kappa\gamma}\nabla f(\mathbf{x}_{t}-\gamma\mathbf{d}_{t-1};% \xi)+(1-\frac{1-\kappa}{\kappa\gamma})\nabla f(\mathbf{x}_{t};\xi)divide start_ARG 1 - italic_Œ∫ end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œ∫ italic_Œ≥ end_ARG ‚àá italic_f ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Œ≥ bold_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_Œæ ) + ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 - italic_Œ∫ end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œ∫ italic_Œ≥ end_ARG ) ‚àá italic_f ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_Œæ ) as the per-sample gradient and apply the Subsampled Gaussian mechanism to privatize it. Therefore, Algorithm 3 and DPSGD share a similar privacy guarantee, as the privacy proof directly follows the Subsampled Gaussian mechanism and the composition of TùëáTitalic_T iterations in Theorem 1. Specifically, by combining Theorem 1 and Theorem 2, we obtain the following privacy-utility trade-off:

Theorem 3

Assume A1-A3 holds. Run Algorithm 3 for T=2‚Å¢N‚Å¢œµ‚Å¢œÉSGDC‚Å¢B‚Å¢d‚Å¢ln‚Å°(1/Œ¥)ùëá2ùëÅitalic-œµsubscriptùúéSGDùê∂ùêµùëë1ùõøT=\frac{\sqrt{2}N\epsilon\sigma_{\mathrm{SGD}}}{C\sqrt{Bd\ln(1/\delta)}}italic_T = divide start_ARG square-root start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_N italic_œµ italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_SGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_C square-root start_ARG italic_B italic_d roman_ln ( 1 / italic_Œ¥ ) end_ARG end_ARG iterations, and choose Œ∫,Œ≤ùúÖùõΩ\kappa,\betaitalic_Œ∫ , italic_Œ≤ according to the choices in Corollary 1, then

1T‚àët=0Tùîº‚à•‚àáF(ùê±t)‚à•2‚â§8‚Å¢C‚Å¢œÉSGD‚Å¢CŒ∫‚Å¢L‚Å¢(F‚Å¢(ùê±0)‚àíF‚ãÜ)‚Å¢d‚Å¢ln‚Å°(1/Œ¥)B‚Å¢N‚Å¢œµ=ùí™(d‚Å¢ln‚Å°(1/Œ¥)N‚Å¢œµ)\frac{1}{T}\sum^{T}_{t=0}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\left\lVert\nabla F(\mathbf{% x}_{t})\right\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{8C\sigma_{\mathrm{SGD}}\sqrt{C_{\kappa}L(F(% \mathbf{x}_{0})-F^{\star})d\ln(1/\delta)}}{\sqrt{B}N\epsilon}=\mathcal{O}\left% (\frac{\sqrt{d\ln(1/\delta)}}{N\epsilon}\right)divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_T end_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E ‚à• ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚â§ divide start_ARG 8 italic_C italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_SGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT square-root start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L ( italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ãÜ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_d roman_ln ( 1 / italic_Œ¥ ) end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_B end_ARG italic_N italic_œµ end_ARG = caligraphic_O ( divide start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_d roman_ln ( 1 / italic_Œ¥ ) end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_N italic_œµ end_ARG ) (10)

Similar to our convergence result, compared to vanilla DPSGD, the privacy-utility trade-off of Algorithm 3 reduces by a constant factor of 1/CŒ∫1subscriptùê∂ùúÖ\sqrt{1/C_{\kappa}}square-root start_ARG 1 / italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∫ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first theoretical result on the utility improvement of a DPSGD-type algorithm without any additional assumptions on the problem.

5 Numerical experiments

We perform extensive pre-training and fine-tuning experiments on various image classification (CV) and natural language processing (NLP) tasks using different base algorithms, privacy budgets, and models. The implementation details of the experiments are given in Appendix C.1. The link to the code is https://anonymous.4open.science/r/KalmanDP-BEDB.

5.1 Experiment settings

Dataset: We train the models on one synthetic dataset, four CV datasets, including MNIST (Deng, 2012), CIFAR-10/CIFAR-100 (Krizhevsky et al., 2009), and ImageNet-1k (Deng et al., 2009), and three NLP dataset, including GLUE (Wang et al., 2018), E2E (Novikova et al., 2017), and DART (Nan et al., 2021).

Model: For the CV tasks, we use three different models, including a 5-layer CNN, WideResNet (WRN) (De et al., 2022), and ViT (Dosovitskiy et al., 2020), representing three typical CV model structures. For the NLP task, we use the RoBERTa (Liu et al., 2019) and the GPT-2 (Radford et al., 2019) models. For pre-training, the models are initialized with random weights, and for fine-tuning with ViT, RoBERTa, and GPT-2, we directly use the checkpoints on HuggingFace (Wolf et al., 2020).

Algorithm: We use the DP version of SGD and Adam for CV tasks, and AdamW for NLP tasks as baselines. Then, we apply DiSK to compare their performance. Additional results on LoRA (Li et al., 2021) are given in Appendix C.4. In the results, we use KF- to denote the privatized version of the algorithms with the DiSK framework.

Hyper-parameter choices: We tune the hyper-parameters using a grid search. Specifically, we conduct a grid search on the batch size BùêµBitalic_B, total epochs E=N‚Å¢T/Bùê∏ùëÅùëáùêµE=NT/Bitalic_E = italic_N italic_T / italic_B, and step size Œ∑ùúÇ\etaitalic_Œ∑ for each given privacy budget œµitalic-œµ\epsilonitalic_œµ. For all experiments, we fix the privacy parameter Œ¥=1/N1.1ùõø1superscriptùëÅ1.1\delta=1/N^{1.1}italic_Œ¥ = 1 / italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1.1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to obtain a reasonable privacy notion. Detailed hyper-parameter choices are discussed in Appendix C.2.

5.2 Numerical results

CV tasks: We first train the CV models with randomly initialized weights on different image datasets. The results for 5-layer CNN on the MNIST dataset, 5-layer CNN on the CIFAR-10 dataset, and WRN-16-4 on the CIFAR-100 datasets with different privacy budgets are given in Figure 1. DiSK  significantly outperforms the base algorithm across all used privacy budgets.

The test accuracy curves during the training for 5-layer CNN on the MNIST dataset, WRN-16-4 on the CIFAR-100 dataset, and ViT-small on the ImageNet-1k dataset are given in Figure 2. The optimizer with DiSK  convergence faster than the base algorithm on all tasks and reaches a higher final accuracy at a given privacy budget. The test accuracy of CIFAR-100 achieves 41.8%percent41.841.8\%41.8 %, and ImageNet-1k achieves 36.4%percent36.436.4\%36.4 %, which outperforms the SOTA results that apply data augmentation under the same privacy budget (40.6%percent40.640.6\%40.6 % for CIFAR-100 (Bao et al., 2024) and 32.4%percent32.432.4\%32.4 % for ImageNet-1k (De et al., 2022)). Additional comparisons on different models, algorithms, and fine-tuning CIFAR-100 are given in Appendix C.3.

NLP tasks: We fine-tune a pre-trained RoBERTa-base model111https://huggingface.co/FacebookAI/roberta-base on the GLUE datasets. The final test accuracy for is given in Table 1. We follow the same training script and hyper-parameter choices in the experiments as Bu et al. (2024). Compared with the base algorithm (DPAdamW), DiSK improves the final accuracy on all tasks by at least 3.8%percent3.83.8\%3.8 % when œµ=1italic-œµ1\epsilon=1italic_œµ = 1 and 1.3%percent1.31.3\%1.3 % when œµ=6.7italic-œµ6.7\epsilon=6.7italic_œµ = 6.7. Additional results for text generation tasks on the E2E ad DART datasets are given in Appendix C.4.

Ablation study: We conduct ablation studies on the choice of the hyper-parameters of DiSK, specifically, how Œ∫,Œ≥ùúÖùõæ\kappa,\gammaitalic_Œ∫ , italic_Œ≥ impact the algorithm performance. The results are presented in Appendix C.3.

Improvements over the SOTA: Table LABEL:tab:app:sota in Appendix C.5 summarizes the improvements of DiSK over the SOTA on different tasks.

Reproducibility Statement

For the algorithm implementation, we provide a link to an anonymous downloadable source code in Section 5. We also discussed the data, model, and algorithms used in the experiment in Section 5 and in Appendix C. For our theoretical results provided in Section 4, we also include clear explanations of the assumptions in the section. The complete proof of the theorems can be found in Appendix B.

Broader Impact

This paper presents work that aims to advance the field of Machine Learning, combining optimization with signal processing and control societies. There are many potential societal consequences of our work, none of which we feel must be specifically highlighted here.

Appendix A Additional discussion

A.1 Background on Kalman Filter

In this section, we provide an introduction and derivation of the Kalman filter. Kalman filter is introduced in (Kalman, 1960) and wildly used for control systems in accurately estimating system states with noisy observation and known system dynamics. Kalman filter assumes the system is a linear (time-invariant) system:

ùúΩtsubscriptùúΩùë°\displaystyle\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùêÄ‚Å¢ùúΩt‚àí1+ùêÆt+ùêØt,absentùêÄsubscriptùúΩùë°1subscriptùêÆùë°subscriptùêØùë°\displaystyle=\mathbf{A}\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t-1}+\mathbf{u}_{t}+\mathbf{v}_{t},= bold_A bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (System update)
ùùçtsubscriptùùçùë°\displaystyle\boldsymbol{\psi}_{t}bold_italic_œà start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùêÇ‚Å¢ùúΩt+ùê∞t,absentùêÇsubscriptùúΩùë°subscriptùê∞ùë°\displaystyle=\mathbf{C}\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}+\mathbf{w}_{t},= bold_C bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (Observation)

where ùêÄ,ùêÇùêÄùêÇ\mathbf{A},\mathbf{C}bold_A , bold_C are known matrix, and ùêØt‚àºùí©(0,Œ£ùêØ),ùê∞t‚àºùí©(,Œ£ùê∞)\mathbf{v}_{t}\sim\mathcal{N}(0,\Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}),\mathbf{w}_{t}\sim% \mathcal{N}(,\Sigma_{\mathbf{w}})bold_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº caligraphic_N ( 0 , roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , bold_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº caligraphic_N ( , roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) follows Gaussian distributions with known covariance matrices Œ£ùêØ,Œ£ùê∞subscriptŒ£ùêØsubscriptŒ£ùê∞\Sigma_{\mathbf{v}},\Sigma_{\mathbf{w}}roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and ùêÆtsubscriptùêÆùë°\mathbf{u}_{t}bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is known input signal. The goal of the Kalman filter is to estimate ùúΩtsubscriptùúΩùë°\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with the observation of ùùçtsubscriptùùçùë°\boldsymbol{\psi}_{t}bold_italic_œà start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with the least mean-square error.

Derivation: First, we denote the estimation of ùúΩtsubscriptùúΩùë°\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as ùúΩ~tsubscript~ùúΩùë°\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and the covariance of ùúΩt‚àíùúΩ~tsubscriptùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩùë°\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t}bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as

ùêèt=ùîº‚Å°[(ùúΩt‚àíùúΩ~t)‚Å¢(ùúΩt‚àíùúΩ~t)‚ä§],subscriptùêèùë°ùîºsubscriptùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩùë°superscriptsubscriptùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩùë°top\mathbf{P}_{t}=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-\tilde{% \boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t})(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_% {t})^{\top}],bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = blackboard_E [ ( bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ,

Then, the system dynamics give an unbiased prediction:

ùúΩ~t|t‚àí1=ùêÄ‚Å¢ùúΩ~t‚àí1+ùêÆt,subscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1ùêÄsubscript~ùúΩùë°1subscriptùêÆùë°\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t|t-1}=\mathbf{A}\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t-1% }+\mathbf{u}_{t},over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_A over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (11)

and its covariance is

ùêèt|t‚àí1=ùîº‚Å°[(ùúΩt‚àíùúΩ~t|t‚àí1)‚Å¢(ùúΩt‚àíùúΩ~t|t‚àí1)‚ä§]=ùêÄùêèt‚àí1‚Å¢ùêÄ‚ä§+Œ£ùêØ.subscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1ùîºsubscriptùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1superscriptsubscriptùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1topsubscriptùêÄùêèùë°1superscriptùêÄtopsubscriptŒ£ùêØ\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-\tilde{% \boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t|t-1})(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-\tilde{\boldsymbol{% \theta}}_{t|t-1})^{\top}]=\mathbf{A}\mathbf{P}_{t-1}\mathbf{A}^{\top}+\Sigma_{% \mathbf{v}}.bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = blackboard_E [ ( bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] = bold_AP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (12)

With ùúΩ~t|t‚àí1subscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t|t-1}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have the prediction error Œî‚Å¢ùùçt=ùùçt‚àíùêÇ‚Å¢ùùç~t|t‚àí1.Œîsubscriptùùçùë°subscriptùùçùë°ùêÇsubscript~ùùçconditionalùë°ùë°1\Delta\boldsymbol{\psi}_{t}=\boldsymbol{\psi}_{t}-\mathbf{C}\tilde{\boldsymbol% {\psi}}_{t|t-1}.roman_Œî bold_italic_œà start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_italic_œà start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_C over~ start_ARG bold_italic_œà end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . Since the system is linear, we would like to use the prediction error to correct the prediction:

ùúΩ~t=ùúΩ~t|t‚àí1+ùêät‚Å¢Œî‚Å¢ùùçt=ùêät‚Å¢ùùçt+(ùêà‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùêÇ)‚Å¢ùúΩ~t|t‚àí1.subscript~ùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptùêäùë°Œîsubscriptùùçùë°subscriptùêäùë°subscriptùùçùë°ùêàsubscriptùêäùë°ùêÇsubscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t}=\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t|t-1}+\mathbf{K}% _{t}\Delta\boldsymbol{\psi}_{t}=\mathbf{K}_{t}\boldsymbol{\psi}_{t}+(\mathbf{I% }-\mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C})\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t|t-1}.over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Œî bold_italic_œà start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_œà start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ( bold_I - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C ) over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (13)

The goal of the Kalman filter is to minimize the mean-square error: minùêä‚Å°ùîº‚Å°[‚à•ùúΩt‚àíùúΩ~t‚à•2],subscriptùêäùîºsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•subscriptùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩùë°2\min_{\mathbf{K}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[\left\lVert\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-% \tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t}\right\rVert^{2}],roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ‚à• bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] , which is equivalent to minimizing tr‚Å¢(ùêèt).trsubscriptùêèùë°\mathrm{tr}(\mathbf{P}_{t}).roman_tr ( bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . From the definition of ùúΩ~t,subscript~ùúΩùë°\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t},over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , we have:

ùêètsubscriptùêèùë°\displaystyle\mathbf{P}_{t}bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùîº‚Å°[(ùúΩt‚àíùúΩ~t)‚Å¢(ùúΩt‚àíùúΩ~t)‚ä§]absentùîºsubscriptùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩùë°superscriptsubscriptùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩùë°top\displaystyle=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-\tilde{% \boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t})(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_% {t})^{\top}]= blackboard_E [ ( bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]
=ùîº‚Å°[(ùúΩt‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùùçt+(ùêà‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùêÇ)‚Å¢ùúΩ~t|t‚àí1)‚Å¢(ùúΩt‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùùçt+(ùêà‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùêÇ)‚Å¢ùúΩ~t|t‚àí1)‚ä§]absentùîºsubscriptùúΩùë°subscriptùêäùë°subscriptùùçùë°ùêàsubscriptùêäùë°ùêÇsubscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1superscriptsubscriptùúΩùë°subscriptùêäùë°subscriptùùçùë°ùêàsubscriptùêäùë°ùêÇsubscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1top\displaystyle=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-\mathbf{K}_{t% }\boldsymbol{\psi}_{t}+(\mathbf{I}-\mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C})\tilde{\boldsymbol% {\theta}}_{t|t-1})(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-\mathbf{K}_{t}\boldsymbol{\psi}_{t}% +(\mathbf{I}-\mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C})\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t|t-1})^{% \top}]= blackboard_E [ ( bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_œà start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ( bold_I - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C ) over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_œà start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ( bold_I - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C ) over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]
=ùîº‚Å°[(ùúΩt‚àíùúΩ~t|t‚àí1‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùêÇ‚Å¢(ùúΩt‚àíùúΩ~t|t‚àí1)‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùê∞t)‚Å¢(ùúΩt‚àíùúΩ~t|t‚àí1‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùêÇ‚Å¢(ùúΩt‚àíùúΩ~t|t‚àí1)‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùê∞t)‚ä§]absentùîºsubscriptùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptùêäùë°ùêÇsubscriptùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptùêäùë°subscriptùê∞ùë°superscriptsubscriptùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptùêäùë°ùêÇsubscriptùúΩùë°subscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptùêäùë°subscriptùê∞ùë°top\displaystyle=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-\tilde{% \boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t|t-1}-\mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C}(\boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-% \tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t|t-1})-\mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{w}_{t})(\boldsymbol% {\theta}_{t}-\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t|t-1}-\mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C}(% \boldsymbol{\theta}_{t}-\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t|t-1})-\mathbf{K}_{t}% \mathbf{w}_{t})^{\top}]= blackboard_E [ ( bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C ( bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C ( bold_italic_Œ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]
=ùêèt|t‚àí1‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùêÇùêèt|t‚àí1‚àí(ùêät‚Å¢ùêÇùêèt|t‚àí1)‚ä§+ùêät‚Å¢(ùêÇùêèt|t‚àí1‚Å¢ùêÇ‚ä§+Œ£ùê∞)‚Å¢ùêät‚ä§.absentsubscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptùêäùë°subscriptùêÇùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1superscriptsubscriptùêäùë°subscriptùêÇùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1topsubscriptùêäùë°subscriptùêÇùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1superscriptùêÇtopsubscriptŒ£ùê∞superscriptsubscriptùêäùë°top\displaystyle=\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}-\mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C}\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}-(% \mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C}\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1})^{\top}+\mathbf{K}_{t}(\mathbf{C}% \mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}\mathbf{C}^{\top}+\Sigma_{\mathbf{w}})\mathbf{K}_{t}^{\top}.= bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_CP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_CP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_CP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

Taking partial derivative to the trace of ùêètsubscriptùêèùë°\mathbf{P}_{t}bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with respect to ùêätsubscriptùêäùë°\mathbf{K}_{t}bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and set it to zero, we have:

‚àÇtr‚Å¢(ùêèt)‚àÇùêät=‚àí2‚Å¢(ùêÇùêèt|t‚àí1)‚ä§+2‚Å¢(ùêÇùêèt|t‚àí1‚Å¢ùêÇ‚ä§+Œ£ùê∞)‚Å¢ùêät‚ä§=0,trsubscriptùêèùë°subscriptùêäùë°2superscriptsubscriptùêÇùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1top2subscriptùêÇùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1superscriptùêÇtopsubscriptŒ£ùê∞superscriptsubscriptùêäùë°top0\frac{\partial\mathrm{tr}(\mathbf{P}_{t})}{\partial\mathbf{K}_{t}}=-2(\mathbf{% C}\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1})^{\top}+2(\mathbf{C}\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}\mathbf{C}^{\top}+% \Sigma_{\mathbf{w}})\mathbf{K}_{t}^{\top}=0,divide start_ARG ‚àÇ roman_tr ( bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ‚àÇ bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = - 2 ( bold_CP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 2 ( bold_CP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 0 ,

which gives

ùêät=ùêèt|t‚àí1‚Å¢ùêÇ‚ä§‚Å¢(ùêÇùêèt|t‚àí1‚Å¢ùêÇ‚ä§+Œ£ùê∞)‚àí1.subscriptùêäùë°subscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1superscriptùêÇtopsuperscriptsubscriptùêÇùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1superscriptùêÇtopsubscriptŒ£ùê∞1\mathbf{K}_{t}=\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}\mathbf{C}^{\top}(\mathbf{C}\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1% }\mathbf{C}^{\top}+\Sigma_{\mathbf{w}})^{-1}.bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_CP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (14)

Substitute ùêätsubscriptùêäùë°\mathbf{K}_{t}bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT back to ùêèt,subscriptùêèùë°\mathbf{P}_{t},bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , we can simplify

ùêètsubscriptùêèùë°\displaystyle\mathbf{P}_{t}bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùêèt|t‚àí1‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùêÇùêèt|t‚àí1‚àí(ùêät‚Å¢ùêÇùêèt|t‚àí1)‚ä§+ùêät‚Å¢(ùêÇùêèt|t‚àí1‚Å¢ùêÇ‚ä§+Œ£ùê∞)‚Å¢ùêät‚ä§absentsubscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptùêäùë°subscriptùêÇùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1superscriptsubscriptùêäùë°subscriptùêÇùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1topsubscriptùêäùë°subscriptùêÇùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1superscriptùêÇtopsubscriptŒ£ùê∞superscriptsubscriptùêäùë°top\displaystyle=\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}-\mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C}\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}-(% \mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C}\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1})^{\top}+\mathbf{K}_{t}(\mathbf{C}% \mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}\mathbf{C}^{\top}+\Sigma_{\mathbf{w}})\mathbf{K}_{t}^{\top}= bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_CP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_CP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_CP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (15)
=ùêèt|t‚àí1‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùêÇùêèt|t‚àí1=(ùêà‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùêÇ)‚Å¢ùêèt|t‚àí1.absentsubscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptùêäùë°subscriptùêÇùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1ùêàsubscriptùêäùë°ùêÇsubscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle=\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}-\mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C}\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}=(% \mathbf{I}-\mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C})\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}.= bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_CP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( bold_I - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C ) bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Combining (11)-(15) together, we have the update of the Kalman filter:

ùúΩ~t|t‚àí1subscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t|t-1}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùêÄ‚Å¢ùúΩ~t‚àí1+ùêÆtabsentùêÄsubscript~ùúΩùë°1subscriptùêÆùë°\displaystyle=\mathbf{A}\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t-1}+\mathbf{u}_{t}= bold_A over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
ùêèt|t‚àí1subscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùêÄùêèt‚àí1‚Å¢ùêÄ‚ä§+Œ£ùêØabsentsubscriptùêÄùêèùë°1superscriptùêÄtopsubscriptŒ£ùêØ\displaystyle=\mathbf{A}\mathbf{P}_{t-1}\mathbf{A}^{\top}+\Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}= bold_AP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
ùêätsubscriptùêäùë°\displaystyle\mathbf{K}_{t}bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùêèt|t‚àí1‚Å¢ùêÇ‚ä§‚Å¢(ùêÇùêèt|t‚àí1‚Å¢ùêÇ‚ä§+Œ£ùê∞)‚àí1absentsubscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1superscriptùêÇtopsuperscriptsubscriptùêÇùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1superscriptùêÇtopsubscriptŒ£ùê∞1\displaystyle=\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}\mathbf{C}^{\top}(\mathbf{C}\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}% \mathbf{C}^{\top}+\Sigma_{\mathbf{w}})^{-1}= bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_CP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
ùúΩ~tsubscript~ùúΩùë°\displaystyle\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{t}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =(ùêà‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùêÇ)‚Å¢ùúΩ~t|t‚àí1+ùêät‚Å¢ùùçtabsentùêàsubscriptùêäùë°ùêÇsubscript~ùúΩconditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptùêäùë°subscriptùùçùë°\displaystyle=(\mathbf{I}-\mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C})\tilde{\boldsymbol{\theta}}% _{t|t-1}+\mathbf{K}_{t}\boldsymbol{\psi}_{t}= ( bold_I - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C ) over~ start_ARG bold_italic_Œ∏ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_œà start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
ùêètsubscriptùêèùë°\displaystyle\mathbf{P}_{t}bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =(ùêà‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùêÇ)‚Å¢ùêèt|t‚àí1.absentùêàsubscriptùêäùë°ùêÇsubscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle=(\mathbf{I}-\mathbf{K}_{t}\mathbf{C})\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}.= ( bold_I - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C ) bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Variants of Kalman filter: Kalman filter is designed for estimating the states following linear dynamics and achieves optimal performance, i.e., gives the smallest mean square error of the estimation when the system is linear (Welch et al., 1995). Extended Kalman filter (EKF) and unscented Kalman filter (UKF) are developed to deal with non-linear systems. EKF linearizes the non-linear system at each step and performs the Kalman filter on the linearized system (Ribeiro, 2004), while UKF takes the effect of the system non-linearity to the noise distribution into consideration and applies the unscented transform on the noise distribution and applies the Kalman filter on the system and the noise distribution (Wan & Van Der Merwe, 2001). Other extensions of the Kalman filter have been developed for special cases, including multiplicative noise and noisy input ùêÆtsubscriptùêÆùë°\mathbf{u}_{t}bold_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (Wu et al., 2016).

A.2 Other system dynamics for DPSGD

In this section, we want to discuss other possible formulations of the system dynamics for DPSGD to apply the Kalman filter.

Optimization variable and gradient version 1: Other than only using the gradients‚Äô dynamics in the main paper, we can construct the system taking the dynamics of the optimization variable ùê±ùê±\mathbf{x}bold_x into the system (Vuckovic, 2018):

[ùê±t+1‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±t+1)]delimited-[]subscriptùê±ùë°1‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±ùë°1\displaystyle\left[\begin{array}[]{c}\mathbf{x}_{t+1}\\ \nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{t+1})\end{array}\right][ start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY ] =[ùêà‚àíŒ∑‚Å¢ùêà0ùêà]‚Å¢[ùê±t‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±t)]+[Œ∑‚Å¢ùê∞t0],absentdelimited-[]ùêàùúÇùêà0ùêàdelimited-[]subscriptùê±ùë°‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±ùë°delimited-[]ùúÇsubscriptùê∞ùë°0\displaystyle=\left[\begin{array}[]{cc}\mathbf{I}&-\eta\mathbf{I}\\ 0&\mathbf{I}\end{array}\right]\left[\begin{array}[]{c}\mathbf{x}_{t}\\ \nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{t})\end{array}\right]+\left[\begin{array}[]{c}\eta\mathbf% {w}_{t}\\ 0\end{array}\right],= [ start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL bold_I end_CELL start_CELL - italic_Œ∑ bold_I end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL start_CELL bold_I end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY ] [ start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY ] + [ start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL italic_Œ∑ bold_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY ] ,
ùê≤tsubscriptùê≤ùë°\displaystyle\mathbf{y}_{t}bold_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùê±t.absentsubscriptùê±ùë°\displaystyle=\mathbf{x}_{t}.= bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

However, this dynamic is inaccurate as the dynamics of the gradient are simplified to ‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±t+1)=‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±t)‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±ùë°1‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±ùë°\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{t+1})=\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{t})‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Although the update can further incorporate with the momentum methods, i.e., by adding a momentum ùê¶tsubscriptùê¶ùë°\mathbf{m}_{t}bold_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT into the system, it fails to reveal the actual dynamic of the system.

Optimization variable and gradient version 2: Instead of treating the gradient as a constant, we can further utilize the Hessian to reveal the gradient dynamics:

[ùê±t+1ùê±t‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±t)]delimited-[]subscriptùê±ùë°1subscriptùê±ùë°‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±ùë°\displaystyle\left[\begin{array}[]{c}\mathbf{x}_{t+1}\\ \mathbf{x}_{t}\\ \nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{t})\end{array}\right][ start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY ] =[ùêà‚àíŒ∑‚Å¢ùêáŒ∑‚Å¢ùêá‚àíŒ∑‚Å¢ùêàùêà00ùêá‚àíùêáùêà]‚Å¢[ùê±tùê±t‚àí1‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±t‚àí1)]+[Œ∑‚Å¢ùê∞t00],absentdelimited-[]ùêàùúÇùêáùúÇùêáùúÇùêàùêà00ùêáùêáùêàdelimited-[]subscriptùê±ùë°subscriptùê±ùë°1‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±ùë°1delimited-[]ùúÇsubscriptùê∞ùë°00\displaystyle=\left[\begin{array}[]{ccc}\mathbf{I}-\eta\mathbf{H}&\eta\mathbf{% H}&-\eta\mathbf{I}\\ \mathbf{I}&0&0\\ \mathbf{H}&-\mathbf{H}&\mathbf{I}\end{array}\right]\left[\begin{array}[]{c}% \mathbf{x}_{t}\\ \mathbf{x}_{t-1}\\ \nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{t-1})\end{array}\right]+\left[\begin{array}[]{c}\eta% \mathbf{w}_{t}\\ 0\\ 0\end{array}\right],= [ start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL bold_I - italic_Œ∑ bold_H end_CELL start_CELL italic_Œ∑ bold_H end_CELL start_CELL - italic_Œ∑ bold_I end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL bold_I end_CELL start_CELL 0 end_CELL start_CELL 0 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL bold_H end_CELL start_CELL - bold_H end_CELL start_CELL bold_I end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY ] [ start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY ] + [ start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL italic_Œ∑ bold_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY ] ,
ùê≤tsubscriptùê≤ùë°\displaystyle\mathbf{y}_{t}bold_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùê±t.absentsubscriptùê±ùë°\displaystyle=\mathbf{x}_{t}.= bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

This system is more accurate in evaluating the gradient at the cost of using an extra ùê±t‚àí1subscriptùê±ùë°1\mathbf{x}_{t-1}bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT state and a larger transition matrix. For non-linear problems F‚Å¢(ùê±)ùêπùê±F(\mathbf{x})italic_F ( bold_x ), where ùêáùêá\mathbf{H}bold_H is not a constant, we can apply the extended Kalman filter and replace ùêáùêá\mathbf{H}bold_H with ùêátsubscriptùêáùë°\mathbf{H}_{t}bold_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT that linearizes the problem at each time step.

Gradient and Hessian: In work (Bittner & Pronzato, 2004), the dynamics of the gradient and Hessian have been used to construct the system:

[‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±t+1)ùê°t+1]delimited-[]‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±ùë°1subscriptùê°ùë°1\displaystyle\left[\begin{array}[]{c}\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{t+1})\\ \mathbf{h}_{t+1}\end{array}\right][ start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL bold_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY ] =[ùêàŒî‚Å¢ùêót0ùêà]‚Å¢[‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±t)ùê°t],absentdelimited-[]ùêàŒîsubscriptùêóùë°0ùêàdelimited-[]‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±ùë°subscriptùê°ùë°\displaystyle=\left[\begin{array}[]{cc}\mathbf{I}&\Delta\mathbf{X}_{t}\\ 0&\mathbf{I}\end{array}\right]\left[\begin{array}[]{c}\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{t})% \\ \mathbf{h}_{t}\end{array}\right],= [ start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL bold_I end_CELL start_CELL roman_Œî bold_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL start_CELL bold_I end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY ] [ start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL bold_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY ] ,
ùê†tsubscriptùê†ùë°\displaystyle\mathbf{g}_{t}bold_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =‚àáF‚Å¢(ùê±t)+ùê∞t,absent‚àáùêπsubscriptùê±ùë°subscriptùê∞ùë°\displaystyle=\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{t})+\mathbf{w}_{t},= ‚àá italic_F ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + bold_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,

where ùê°t=[ùêá1,1,‚Ä¶,ùêái,i+j,‚Ä¶,ùêád,d]‚ä§,subscriptùê°ùë°superscriptsubscriptùêá11‚Ä¶subscriptùêáùëñùëñùëó‚Ä¶subscriptùêáùëëùëëtop\mathbf{h}_{t}=[\mathbf{H}_{1,1},\dots,\mathbf{H}_{i,i+j},\dots,\mathbf{H}_{d,% d}]^{\top},bold_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ bold_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , bold_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_i + italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , bold_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , with j‚àà[0,‚Ä¶,d‚àíi]ùëó0‚Ä¶ùëëùëñj\in[0,\dots,d-i]italic_j ‚àà [ 0 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_d - italic_i ] represents the entries in the upper triangular part of the Hessian matrix. Œî‚Å¢ùêótŒîsubscriptùêóùë°\Delta\mathbf{X}_{t}roman_Œî bold_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is constructed such that Œî‚Å¢ùêót‚Å¢ùê°t=ùêát‚Å¢(ùê±t+1‚àíùê±t).Œîsubscriptùêóùë°subscriptùê°ùë°subscriptùêáùë°subscriptùê±ùë°1subscriptùê±ùë°\Delta\mathbf{X}_{t}\mathbf{h}_{t}=\mathbf{H}_{t}(\mathbf{x}_{t+1}-\mathbf{x}_% {t}).roman_Œî bold_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . The system treats the Hessian matrix as a constant matrix, and the transition matrix is of size (d+d‚Å¢(d‚àí1)/2)√ód+d‚Å¢(d‚àí1)/2.ùëëùëëùëë12ùëëùëëùëë12(d+d(d-1)/2)\times d+d(d-1)/2.( italic_d + italic_d ( italic_d - 1 ) / 2 ) √ó italic_d + italic_d ( italic_d - 1 ) / 2 .

Although there are different ways to construct the Kamlan filter for gradient noise reduction, the above systems are not implementable in practical deep-learning applications. Because the transition matrices of these systems are non-diagonal, the Kalman filters have non-diagonal gain ùêätsubscriptùêäùë°\mathbf{K}_{t}bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ùêètsubscriptùêèùë°\mathbf{P}_{t}bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Therefore, the matrix inversion operation is unavoidable when Kalman filters are implemented based on these systems. The computation complexity for the matrix inversion can be ùí™‚Å¢(d3)ùí™superscriptùëë3\mathcal{O}(d^{3})caligraphic_O ( italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) to ùí™‚Å¢(d6),ùí™superscriptùëë6\mathcal{O}(d^{6}),caligraphic_O ( italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 6 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , and the memory consumption is ùí™‚Å¢(d2)ùí™superscriptùëë2\mathcal{O}(d^{2})caligraphic_O ( italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) to ùí™‚Å¢(d4)ùí™superscriptùëë4\mathcal{O}(d^{4})caligraphic_O ( italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) for storing the matrices of the Kalman filter.

A.3 Algorithm Simplification

In this section, we explain how the simplification proceeds from Algorithm 2 to Algorithm 3. Recall that updates of Algorithm 2 is

ùê†~t|t‚àí1subscript~ùê†conditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t|t-1}over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùê†~t‚àí1+ùêá~t‚Å¢(ùê±t‚àíùê±t‚àí1)absentsubscript~ùê†ùë°1subscript~ùêáùë°subscriptùê±ùë°subscriptùê±ùë°1\displaystyle=\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t-1}+\tilde{\mathbf{H}}_{t}(\mathbf{x}_{t}-% \mathbf{x}_{t-1})= over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + over~ start_ARG bold_H end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (Prediction)
ùêèt|t‚àí1subscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùêèt‚àí1+Œ£ùêá+Œ£ùêØabsentsubscriptùêèùë°1subscriptŒ£ùêásubscriptŒ£ùêØ\displaystyle=\mathbf{P}_{t-1}+\Sigma_{\mathbf{H}}+\Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}= bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
ùêätsubscriptùêäùë°\displaystyle\mathbf{K}_{t}bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùêèt|t‚àí1ùîº[ùêÇt]‚ä§(Œ£ùê∞+ùîº[ùêÇt](Œ£ùêÇùêít+ùêèt|t‚àí1)ùîº[ùêÇt]‚ä§‚àíŒ£ùêá)‚àí1\displaystyle=\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[\mathbf{C}_{t}]^{% \top}\left(\Sigma_{\mathbf{w}}+\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[\mathbf{C}_{t}]\left(% \Sigma_{\mathbf{C}}\mathbf{S}_{t}+\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}\right)\operatorname{% \mathbb{E}}[\mathbf{C}_{t}]^{\top}-\Sigma_{\mathbf{H}}\right)^{-1}= bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ bold_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + blackboard_E [ bold_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ( roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) blackboard_E [ bold_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
ùê†~tsubscript~ùê†ùë°\displaystyle\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t}over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùê†~t|t‚àí1+ùêät‚Å¢(ùê†t‚àíùîº‚Å°[ùêÇt]‚Å¢ùê†~t|t‚àí1)absentsubscript~ùê†conditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptùêäùë°subscriptùê†ùë°ùîºsubscriptùêÇùë°subscript~ùê†conditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle=\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t|t-1}+\mathbf{K}_{t}(\mathbf{g}_{t}-% \operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[\mathbf{C}_{t}]\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t|t-1})= over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - blackboard_E [ bold_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (Correction)
ùêètsubscriptùêèùë°\displaystyle\mathbf{P}_{t}bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =(ùêà‚àíùêät‚Å¢ùîº‚Å°[ùêÇt])‚Å¢ùêèt|t‚àí1absentùêàsubscriptùêäùë°ùîºsubscriptùêÇùë°subscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle=(\mathbf{I}-\mathbf{K}_{t}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[\mathbf{C}_{% t}])\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}= ( bold_I - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ bold_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ) bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
ùêítsubscriptùêíùë°\displaystyle\mathbf{S}_{t}bold_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùîº‚Å°[ùê†~t‚Å¢ùê†~t‚ä§],absentùîºsubscript~ùê†ùë°superscriptsubscript~ùê†ùë°top\displaystyle=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t}\tilde{\mathbf{g% }}_{t}^{\top}],= blackboard_E [ over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ,

where ùê†t=1B‚Å¢‚àëŒæ‚àà‚Ñ¨tclip‚Å¢(‚àáf‚Å¢(ùê±t;Œæ),C)+ùê∞t.subscriptùê†ùë°1ùêµsubscriptùúâsubscript‚Ñ¨ùë°clip‚àáùëìsubscriptùê±ùë°ùúâùê∂subscriptùê∞ùë°\mathbf{g}_{t}=\frac{1}{B}\sum_{\xi\in\mathcal{B}_{t}}\mathrm{clip}\left(% \nabla f(\mathbf{x}_{t};\xi),C\right)+\mathbf{w}_{t}.bold_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ ‚àà caligraphic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_clip ( ‚àá italic_f ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_Œæ ) , italic_C ) + bold_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . We apply four steps of simplification, including

  1. 1.

    Replacing random ùêÇtsubscriptùêÇùë°\mathbf{C}_{t}bold_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with constant ùêàdsubscriptùêàùëë\mathbf{I}_{d}bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

  2. 2.

    Use finite difference to estimate ùêát‚Å¢ùêùt‚àí1subscriptùêáùë°subscriptùêùùë°1\mathbf{H}_{t}\mathbf{d}_{t-1}bold_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

  3. 3.

    Replace Œ£ùêásubscriptŒ£ùêá\Sigma_{\mathbf{H}}roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with diagonal matrix œÉH2‚Å¢ùêàdsubscriptsuperscriptùúé2ùêªsubscriptùêàùëë\sigma^{2}_{H}\mathbf{I}_{d}italic_œÉ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, Œ£ùêØsubscriptŒ£ùêØ\Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with œÉùêØ2‚Å¢ùêàdsubscriptsuperscriptùúé2ùêØsubscriptùêàùëë\sigma^{2}_{\mathbf{v}}\mathbf{I}_{d}italic_œÉ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and Œ£ùê∞subscriptŒ£ùê∞\Sigma_{\mathbf{w}}roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with œÉùê∞2‚Å¢ùêàdsubscriptsuperscriptùúé2ùê∞subscriptùêàùëë\sigma^{2}_{\mathbf{w}}\mathbf{I}_{d}italic_œÉ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

  4. 4.

    Use fixed filter gain Œ∫ùúÖ\kappaitalic_Œ∫.

Step 1. By replacing ùêÇtsubscriptùêÇùë°\mathbf{C}_{t}bold_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with ùêàdsubscriptùêàùëë\mathbf{I}_{d}bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and Œ£ùêÇ=0subscriptŒ£ùêÇ0\Sigma_{\mathbf{C}}=0roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0, the update becomes

ùê†~t|t‚àí1subscript~ùê†conditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t|t-1}over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùê†~t‚àí1+ùêá~t‚Å¢(ùê±t‚àíùê±t‚àí1)absentsubscript~ùê†ùë°1subscript~ùêáùë°subscriptùê±ùë°subscriptùê±ùë°1\displaystyle=\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t-1}+\tilde{\mathbf{H}}_{t}(\mathbf{x}_{t}-% \mathbf{x}_{t-1})= over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + over~ start_ARG bold_H end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (Prediction)
ùêèt|t‚àí1subscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùêèt‚àí1+Œ£ùêá+Œ£ùêØabsentsubscriptùêèùë°1subscriptŒ£ùêásubscriptŒ£ùêØ\displaystyle=\mathbf{P}_{t-1}+\Sigma_{\mathbf{H}}+\Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}= bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
ùêätsubscriptùêäùë°\displaystyle\mathbf{K}_{t}bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùêèt|t‚àí1‚Å¢(Œ£ùê∞+ùêèt|t‚àí1‚àíŒ£ùêá)‚àí1absentsubscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1superscriptsubscriptŒ£ùê∞subscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptŒ£ùêá1\displaystyle=\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}\left(\Sigma_{\mathbf{w}}+\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}-% \Sigma_{\mathbf{H}}\right)^{-1}= bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
ùê†~tsubscript~ùê†ùë°\displaystyle\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t}over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùê†~t|t‚àí1+ùêät‚Å¢(ùê†t‚àíùê†~t|t‚àí1)absentsubscript~ùê†conditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptùêäùë°subscriptùê†ùë°subscript~ùê†conditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle=\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t|t-1}+\mathbf{K}_{t}(\mathbf{g}_{t}-\tilde{% \mathbf{g}}_{t|t-1})= over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (Correction)
ùêètsubscriptùêèùë°\displaystyle\mathbf{P}_{t}bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =(ùêà‚àíùêät)‚Å¢ùêèt|t‚àí1.absentùêàsubscriptùêäùë°subscriptùêèconditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle=(\mathbf{I}-\mathbf{K}_{t})\mathbf{P}_{t|t-1}.= ( bold_I - bold_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Step 2. By using the finite difference to estimate ùêát‚Å¢ùêùt‚àí1subscriptùêáùë°subscriptùêùùë°1\mathbf{H}_{t}\mathbf{d}_{t-1}bold_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the prediction step becomes:

ùê†~t|t‚àí1=ùê†~t‚àí1+1B‚Å¢‚àëŒæ‚àà‚Ñ¨t‚àáf‚Å¢(ùê±t+Œ≥‚Å¢ùêùt‚àí1;Œæ)‚àí‚àáf‚Å¢(ùê±t;Œæ)Œ≥(Prediction).subscript~ùê†conditionalùë°ùë°1subscript~ùê†ùë°11ùêµsubscriptùúâsubscript‚Ñ¨ùë°‚àáùëìsubscriptùê±ùë°ùõæsubscriptùêùùë°1ùúâ‚àáùëìsubscriptùê±ùë°ùúâùõæ(Prediction)\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t|t-1}=\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t-1}+\frac{1}{B}\sum_{\xi\in% \mathcal{B}_{t}}\frac{\nabla f(\mathbf{x}_{t}+\gamma\mathbf{d}_{t-1};\xi)-% \nabla f(\mathbf{x}_{t};\xi)}{\gamma}\qquad\textit{(Prediction)}.over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ ‚àà caligraphic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG ‚àá italic_f ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_Œ≥ bold_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_Œæ ) - ‚àá italic_f ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_Œæ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œ≥ end_ARG (Prediction) .

Step 3. By replacing Œ£Œ£\Sigmaroman_Œ£‚Äôs with diagonal matrix œÉ2‚Å¢ùêàdsuperscriptùúé2subscriptùêàùëë\sigma^{2}\mathbf{I}_{d}italic_œÉ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT‚Äôs, the update becomes:

ùê†~t|t‚àí1subscript~ùê†conditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t|t-1}over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùê†~t‚àí1+1B‚Å¢‚àëŒæ‚àà‚Ñ¨t‚àáf‚Å¢(ùê±t+Œ≥‚Å¢ùêùt‚àí1;Œæ)‚àí‚àáf‚Å¢(ùê±t;Œæ)Œ≥absentsubscript~ùê†ùë°11ùêµsubscriptùúâsubscript‚Ñ¨ùë°‚àáùëìsubscriptùê±ùë°ùõæsubscriptùêùùë°1ùúâ‚àáùëìsubscriptùê±ùë°ùúâùõæ\displaystyle=\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t-1}+\frac{1}{B}\sum_{\xi\in\mathcal{B}_{t}}% \frac{\nabla f(\mathbf{x}_{t}+\gamma\mathbf{d}_{t-1};\xi)-\nabla f(\mathbf{x}_% {t};\xi)}{\gamma}= over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ ‚àà caligraphic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG ‚àá italic_f ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_Œ≥ bold_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_Œæ ) - ‚àá italic_f ( bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_Œæ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œ≥ end_ARG (Prediction)

ùê†~tsubscript~ùê†ùë°\displaystyle\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t}over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =ùê†~t|t‚àí1+kt‚Å¢(ùê†t‚àíùê†~t|t‚àí1)absentsubscript~ùê†conditionalùë°ùë°1subscriptùëòùë°subscriptùê†ùë°subscript~ùê†conditionalùë°ùë°1\displaystyle=\tilde{\mathbf{g}}_{t|t-1}+k_{t}(\mathbf{g}_{t}-\tilde{\mathbf{g% }}_{t|t-1})= over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_k start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over~ start_ARG bold_g end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (Correction)
